Welcome to Christopher Salumn, our new Director of Physical Education, Health & Athletics as of 9/1/20! #Carmel6Cs

From Mr. Salumn: I have been the Director of Health, Physical Education, and Athletics for the Haldane Central School District for the last 5 years. Prior to that, I was a physical education teacher and Varsity Baseball Coach for the Peekskill City School District. I am a graduate of Carmel High School and am excited to give back to the community I grew up in. Carmel has a strong history of academic and athletic success and I am looking forward to continuing that tradition. Go Rams!

post_text: A group of GFMS 8th grade Girl Scouts touched on all #Carmel6Cs when they decided to sew pouches for orphaned joeys in Australia. Joeys are baby marsupials, such as kangaroos. Due to the devastating fires in Australia, many have become orphans. Typically, baby kangaroos spend up to 8 months or more in their mother’s protective pouch. Since the fires have killed so many mother kangaroos, the Wildcare Australia organization put a call out for hand-sewn pouches as a warm & secure alternative. Thanks, Mrs. Vanacoro, for helping with this very worthwhile project. Kudos girls!

The Westchester Science and Engineering Fair (WESEF) is the largest science fair in our region, and it supports and inspires students who are pursuing science research in high school. This year WESEF will have a record number of participants (700+) including many from Carmel High School as well as surrounding communities. WESEF relies on local volunteers in the science field to serve as judges.
If you are in any field of science—such as medicine, psychology, engineering, mathematics, computer science, etc., please consider serving as a volunteer judge. It requires a 3-4 hour commitment on the morning of Saturday, March 21. More details and a link to register can be found at www.wesef.org/for-judges/.

post_text: Visited the MPES Collaboratory last week. CCSD defines Collaboratory as "a center without walls, a place where minds collide to drive innovation--that aids the 6Cs." Each of our elementary schools has one (the room takes the place of the old computer labs) and they feature such things as movable tables, write-on desks, a green screen area, laptop cart, brightly painted walls, a large white board wall, and colorful seating options. Teachers and students are just beginning to explore ways to creatively use the space. For example, one group of teachers got together to learn how to use the green screen app and 4th grade teacher Jacqueline Zulauf set up stations for her students to learn about Native Americans. #Carmel6Cs

post_text: KPS students had the opportunity to thank our local Veterans by signing an appreciation card today. The signed cards will be shared with Veterans at the Carmel VFW, in local nursing homes and sent to Veterans through United for the Troops. Our thanks to event organizer Megan Castellano and the KPS PTO for supporting this special event. Special thanks also to Karl Rohde, Director of the Putnam County Veterans Service Agency for coming to share his personal artifacts from his time in the service. To all our Veterans, we thank you for your service! #Carmel6Cs #Citizenship

post_text: KES kindergartener Seamus O'Hara (in Mrs. Douglas' class) was so excited to share his family's passion for restoring vintage cars. His dad and grandpa came to school today in a 1937 Chevrolet truck and a 1940 Plymouth. They also brought along a 1950's toy car. The kids got to climb into the truck, listen to the horn on the Plymouth (so loud!), and try out the toy car. What fun! Grandpa Steubing also showed the kids some vintage license plates--the earliest of which was from 1917! #Carme6Cs
